title: 2016 ATH Ratkovich has game
text:
2016 ATH Ratkovich has game EDGYTIM Talk about it in the edgytim Message Boards 
Crete (Ill.) Monee senior athlete prospect Clint Ratkovich (6-foot-2, 205 pounds) has been a three year starter for the Warriors and head coach John Konecki and Ratkovich checks in and talks about recruiting, his season and more here. 
"Our season has been going pretty well," Ratkovich said. "We are 7-1 and our only loss was early to Brother Rice. We have another big game this week against Prairie Ridge and then we start the state playoffs." 
Ratkovich, who has played all over the field in his varsity career at Crete-Monee has played at quarterback, running back, receiver along with outside linebacker. 
"I just like to go out and help the team in anyway I can. We have a younger quarterback so I played a lot of quarterback early in the season and now I'm playing more at running back and receiver. I'm also playing outside linebacker on defense and when it comes to a position in college I'm pretty open." 
Ratkovich talked about his latest recruiting news. 
"I've been in contact and staying in touch with the coaches from North Dakota State, Illinois State along with several of the Missouri Valley conference schools along with some smaller level schools. The coaches all wanted to see my senior video so I've been sending that along to them each week. They want me to stay in touch and said they also want me to come out and see a game this season." 
Ratkovich also has big career plans after college.. 
"I'm looking at majoring in electrical engineering. I've always been interested in that field and I'm excited to learn more about it in college."
